idioms.meaning: to be in the firing line
to be selected (from among many people)
to select someone (out of many people)

lessons.japanese: 議長が批判の矢面に立った。
lessons.english: The brunt of criticism was borne by the chairmen.

lessons.japanese: 我が社の新製品が、ライバル会社に一矢を報いる結果となった。
lessons.english: This new product of ours is a serious blow to our rival company.

lessons.japanese: 一本の矢が鷹を貫通した。
lessons.english: An arrow passed through the hawk.

lessons.japanese: 無理矢理サインをさせられたのなら、その契約は無効です。
lessons.english: The contract, if you were forced to sign it, is invalid.

lessons.japanese: 無理矢理サインさせられたのなら、その契約は無効ですよ。
lessons.english: The contract, if you were forced to sign it, is invalid.

lessons.japanese: 矢は的からひどく外れた。
lessons.english: The arrow fell wide of the mark.

lessons.japanese: その矢は的から大きく外れた。
lessons.english: The arrow fell wide of the mark.

lessons.japanese: ウイリアム・テルは息子の頭の上のリンゴをねらって矢を射た。
lessons.english: William Tell shot an arrow at the apple on his son's head.

lessons.japanese: インディアンは弓と矢で戦った。
lessons.english: The Indians fought with bows and arrows.

lessons.japanese: ７歳の時、すでに自ら弓と矢を作った。
lessons.english: By the age of seven, he had already made his own bow and arrows.

lessons.japanese: 矢印は東京へ行く道を示す。
lessons.english: The arrow indicates the way to Tokyo.

lessons.japanese: 矢印が進むべき方向を指示する。
lessons.english: The arrow indicates the way to go.
The arrow glanced off the tree.

lessons.japanese: 矢は的に届かなかった。
lessons.english: The arrow fell short of the target.
